CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (six-month period);Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant association was registered in DATE by ORG ( “ the GPE ” ) at the following address : CARDINAL , Revolution Place , PERSON , GPE . However , the applicant association has since moved to CARDINAL - CARDINAL , FAC , PERSON . As appears from the materials of the case , in particular , from the letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG was aware of the applicant association ’s actual address .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a new PERSON on non - governmental organisations was enacted . The PERSON required that all NGOs established before DATE be re - registered before DATE . The applicant association applied twice to the ORG seeking re - registration . However , its applications were refused .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant association brought an action against the GPE seeking re - registration of the association . On DATE ORG of GPE allowed the applicant association ’s claim and ordered the ORG to register the applicant association . ORG also ordered the reimbursement by ORG the court fees paid by the applicant association . That decision was upheld by ORG of ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Vice - President of ORG brought an extraordinary appeal ( надзорная жалоба ) against the decisions of DATE and DATE . As appears from the letter of the registry of ORG of DATE , on CARDINAL DATE a copy of the appeal was sent to the applicant association ’s previous address , which appeared in the association ’s official registration documents . On DATE the letter from the registry reached its destination , but it was returned to the sender marked by the postman as follows : “ no [ such ] public organisation is registered [ at this address ] ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG of GPE quashed the lower courts’ decisions by way of a supervisory review . The reasoning of the ORG reads as follows :
“ Pursuant to LAW commercial courts could determine economic disputes arising from civil , administrative and other legal relationships .
Under Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , as well as LAW a public association is a non - profit organisation .

Disputes concerning [ State ] registration or re - registration of non - profit organisations are not economical by their nature and [ hence ] do not fall within the competence of the commercial courts . ”
As a result , the proceedings were discontinued . The hearing took place in the absence of the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE a copy of the decision of ORG was sent to the applicant association ’s previous address . This document was delivered on DATE ; however it was also returned to the registry marked as follows : “ [ this is ] the address of the village council , the receptionist refused to take delivery [ of this letter ] ” .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant association , on several occasions it applied to ORG of GPE with a view to urging ORG to enforce the judgment of CARDINAL DATE , as upheld on DATE , and register the association , but to no avail . In DATE a law clerk of ORG of GPE informed the applicant association of the annulment of the decision of DATE , as upheld on DATE . On DATE the applicant association wrote a letter to the President of ORG asking for a copy of the decision of that court . The applicant association received it on DATE .

CARDINAL . Shortly thereafter the applicant association challenged the refusal of ORG before the courts of general jurisdiction . By a final decision of DATE ORG allowed the applicant association ’s claim , ordering ORG to register the applicant association .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant association challenged the relevant provisions of LAW before LAW . On DATE ORG declared this complaint inadmissible . The ORG found that , although the provisions challenged did not establish any time - limits for bringing an extraordinary appeal , the time within which the appeal was brought in the applicant ’s case had not exceeded the “ reasonable time ” , and , therefore , the applicant ’s rights had not been breached by it .

CARDINAL . The Law On Public Associations ( No . CARDINAL-FZ of CARDINAL DATE , as amended ) , concerning non - profit NGOs , provided that the refusal of the competent ORG to register a public association could be challenged before a court ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Since DATE the NORP judicial system has comprised of CARDINAL elements – courts of general jurisdiction , commercial courts and constitutional courts . LAW of DATE ( No . CARDINAL-FZ of CARDINAL DATE , in force at the material time but repealed on DATE , hereafter “ the old Code ” ) stated that the commercial courts could determine “ economic disputes arising from civil , administrative and other legal relationships ... between legal persons ... ” ( Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the old Code ) . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the old Code provided that “ economic disputes ... include disputes .... challenging the refusal of a ORG body to register a legal person where such registration is required by the Law ” .

CARDINAL . The Code of Commercial Procedure of DATE ( in force from DATE , hereafter “ the new Code ” ) contains a similar provision which defined the competence of the commercial courts based on CARDINAL criteria : the subject matter of the dispute ( “ economic disputes ” ) and the status of the litigants ( “ legal persons ” ) . Article CARDINAL of the new Code stipulates that disputes concerning the creation , reorganisation and liquidation of legal persons was within the competence of the commercial courts .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of ORG of GPE ( No . CARDINAL , of DATE , as in force at the material time ) , ORG had , inter alia , the right to issue recommendations deriving from case - law ( разъяснения по вопросам судебной практики ) . On DATE ORG issued Recommendation no . DATE , “ On certain issues arising in connection with the enactment of LAW ” , which interpreted inter alia LAW . In LAW , ORG specified that the disputes concerning registration of non - profit organisations fall outside the competence of the commercial courts .

CARDINAL . The Code provided that the judgments of commercial courts of first instance could be appealed within DATE of the date of their adoption ( LAW . Decisions of the courts of appeal were amenable to appeal to the court of cassation also within DATE of the date of their adoption ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . LAW also established that any judgment or decision of any commercial court of GPE ( except for the decisions of the Presidium of ORG ) was amenable to supervisory review initiated on application by the President of ORG , or his deputy , or ORG , or his deputy ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . The Code did not list the grounds for lodging an application for supervisory review , or the time - limits for doing so . It specified that it could be lodged either on the initiative of the relevant ORG official or “ in connection with a request by a party to the proceedings ” ( LAW ) . The summoning of parties to a hearing before the Presidium of ORG was a discretionary right of the ORG ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . The Presidium of ORG was the court of final instance within the commercial court system ; no appeal lay against its decisions ( LAW ) .
